channel.title: Prototypes on Digital Land
channel.description: Recent content in Prototypes on Digital Land

item.title: Digital Land Portfolio
item.description: We made a portfolio of patterns and use-cases for digital land data during discovery. We will review the need for this tool, or if it can be iterated to cover the needs for a handbook. Sept 2018 added 2 projects; Bristol Maps and Propective.io updated portfolio to use Govuk design system May 2018 created a portfolio for the team to collect interesting projects in the digital land space categorised these projects according to some patterns we have observed notices better local plans better planning applications geographies information about an area information about a property

item.title: Validator
item.description: This tool will assist publishers ensure their publication meets a standard, such as the brownfield sites register standard, and the emerging standards for Local Plans and Section 106. November 2018 applied the validator to support developer contributions which has multiple files. September 2018 added regex validators to text for correct planning application states July 2018 created validator for brownfield sites (brownfield sites standard) collected links to published brownfield site registers added warnings if the csv file is not served correctly

item.title: Better data standard specifications
item.description: A tool to generate specifications from a formal schema may help people write better specifications.

item.title: Better standard design process
item.description: We need a new, much better approach for people developing data standards, based on needs of users, with scope for learning and iteration.

item.title: Builder
item.description: A tool for making a dataset from scratch. For example, the brownfield sites register requires codes, a webform could include drop-downs and pre-populated fields.

item.title: Business case builder
item.description: Guidance, use-cases, economic models and patterns help more people make more data available.

item.title: Data field dictionary
item.description: We need a distributed way to enable multiple people establishing standards which are consistent with each other. We can work with the registers team on new field register names, and investigate using OSM tags and Wikidata properties.

item.title: Digital Land Collector
item.description: The Digital Land team regularly updates this collection of datasets related to housing and land. We use it to assess the state of published data and gauge the work necessary to keep a copy of a dataset up to date.

item.title: Digital Land Explorer
item.description: We will continue to develop our explorer to better understand data which is available and demonstrate to others how to consume collected data. July 2018 display metadata for each publication/dataset users can exlore individual datasets all data shown on map user can inspect a point or polygon to see properties lazy loading and clustering added so that users can explore larger datasets June 2018 added functionality to find all data we have collected that is related to a user provided address or point add basic search to lists of publications and local authorities May 2018

item.title: Digital Land Handbook
item.description: Guidance and documentation for the collector and explorers to help others to understand how to find data, overcome points of friction and increase the use and trust of government data.

item.title: Maturity Model
item.description: A set of criteria to assess the status of an existing dataset. The collector could use this model and the validator (below) to report on invalid datasets, how frequently each dataset is updated, when a dataset goes missing, etc. These could be surfaced on the explorer.

item.title: Registers
item.description: Building the collector highlighted the need for several authoritative datasets which we have prototyped. Where possible we should identify the appropriate custodian and work with GDS to establish these as GOV.UK registers.

item.title: Supporting feedback
item.description: Tools for soliciting and handling feedback on a geospatial dataset.

item.title: Viewer
item.description: A tool to show an individual dataset on a map and to give other feedback to someone making a dataset before it is published.
